intro: Lellingeria amplisora, commonly known as the broad-leaved bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant features broad, lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture, and it thrives in cool, moist environments. Lellingeria amplisora is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to high-altitude conditions. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to bloom in partial shade.
